intro: Clematis orientalis var. albida, commonly known as the white clematis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits called follicles, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners looking to add ornamental value to their landscapes. Its delicate appearance and fragrance make it a sought-after addition to botanical gardens and cultivated collections.
